channel.title: How much would this pc cost me?
channel.description:
Well, this year I wanted to build my own pc, but I need it PURELY for gaming, since I already have a laptop for school, but I wanted top specs. for example,
[ul][li]Quad core Intel[/li] [li]Latest nvidia geforce[/li] [li]8gb ram[/li] [li]500gb hard drive[/li] [li]a customisable box[/li] [li]24" monitor[/li][/ul]
I was wondering how much something like that would cost? and where to buy it from.
Thanks

item.title: How much would this pc cost me?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“dragonfire455, post:31, topic:275311”][quote author=slayer215 link=topic=363695.msg2772044#msg2772044 date=1241204307]

[ul][li]8gb ram[/li][/ul]

4gb should be plenty, spend the extra money on the gpu since most games are much more gpu dependent than cpu.

Also try to buy stuff in combos are barebones kits together to save money and read reviews
using tiger direct it should be 1000+ usd counting the monitor
[/quote]What the fuck would you do with 8gb of RAM anyways? I’m perfectly fine with 3[/quote]
6 for me and i find it adequate

Read full topic
item.source: How much would this pc cost me?

item.title: How much would this pc cost me?
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:27, topic:275311”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=363695.msg2767925#msg2767925 date=1240938743]

Where do you live? And can you put it together yourself? (it’s easy, like a low-difficulty lego set)

Expensive*
[/quote]

Building your own computer is much cheaper, I just built one for my aunt for $600 and it would have cost at least $2000 if she bought the same thing anywhere. Unless that’s not what you mean…[/quote]
I think he meant, that it’s like an expensive lego set.

Read full topic

A ROPE.

item.title: How much would this pc cost me?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:18, topic:275311”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=363695.msg2767531#msg2767531 date=1240907101]

Where do you live? And can you put it together yourself? (it’s easy, like a low-difficulty lego set)

you say that but some of those pins are a bitch to little sockets on
[/quote]
There was a day when you could easily put the cpu or ram into the motherboard the wrong way and fry it.

Moparisthebest, Since he asked for a price in £ he must be from the UK which has no newegg
In the UK http://www.ebuyer.com/ is a decent PC Hardware retailer (I should have mentioned in first post)[/quote]
novatech.co.uk are better i feel

Read full topic

item.title: How much would this pc cost me?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:12, topic:275311”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=363695.msg2763075#msg2763075 date=1240652950]

you can get an i7 for £216 its a little slower but its still a good CPU or you could get another a 8200 which isnt a bad CPU either

So why is the 3.2GHz i7 three times more expensive than the 2.66GHz i7. I dont understand why 600Mhz costs £500?
Since this is a gaming PC and games on PC are rapidly evolving its better to buy a faster CPU the guarentee a longer life.
[/quote]
the top i7 is not worth the extra cash you are better off with a lower clock speed one and try to overclock it if you want that extra speed that bad its still a good CPU. i think the bus speed and cache are bigger on the top end i7 as well[/quote]
Nope, they’re the same (at least the cache). Lower-end i7 is best bang for one’s buck.

Read full topic
item.source: How much would this pc cost me?

item.title: How much would this pc cost me?
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:9, topic:275311”]It depends if you want quad core 2 3GHz your spending around £270, if you want a Core i7 (with 4 cores) its £700+.
The Graphics card should be around £150-200
If you want a quad core 2 porcesser you want DDR3 ram which will cost around £150 minimun for 8GB.
The Hard Disk should be reletivly cheap (>£50)
A decent PC Case and PSU bundled together should be no more than £100
If you want a motherboard that supports all this you need to only dish out around £100
A 24" moniter is around £200

All together the minimun pirce is around £900.[/quote]
the fuck?

Read full topic
item.source: How much would this pc cost me?

[/quote]

So why is the 3.2GHz i7 three times more expensive than the 2.66GHz i7. I dont understand why 600Mhz costs £500?
Since this is a gaming PC and games on PC are rapidly evolving its better to buy a faster CPU the guarentee a longer life.[/quote]
the top i7 is not worth the extra cash you are better off with a lower clock speed one and try to overclock it if you want that extra speed that bad its still a good CPU. i think the bus speed and cache are bigger on the top end i7 as well
